snippet: The first of two American aid workers infected with Ebola while working in West Africa was admitted to an Atlanta hospital on Saturday.
abstract: Dr Kent Brantly, first of two American aid workers infected with Ebola while working in West Africa, is admitted to Atlanta's Emory University Hospital;, which has containment unit for patients with dangerous infectious diseases; he is believed to be first patient with Ebola, deadly virus, ever to be treated at a United States hospital.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and DENISE GRADY
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Atlanta, and Denise Grady from New York.

lead_paragraph: The first of two American aid workers infected with Ebola while working in West Africa was admitted to an Atlanta hospital on Saturday.

headline.main: American Doctor With Ebola Arrives in U.S. for Treatment
headline.print_headline: American Doctor With Ebola Arrives in U.S. for Treatment

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
